meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party rankled the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site rankled the workers.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog rankled the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent4: The unfair treatment rankled her sense of justice.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on his shirt rankled his skin all day.

meanings.definition: To feel or express irritation or resentment
meanings.sent1: She rankled at the thought of being ignored.
meanings.sent2: He rankled when his ideas were dismissed without consideration.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater rankled the chef with his special requests.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved argument rankled in her mind like a splinter.
meanings.sent5: The criticism rankled, but she tried to let it go.
